text: Psalm 58
Judgment on the Wicked
For the \add music\add* director, \add according to\add* Do not Destroy.
Of David. A miktam.\f + \fr Ps 58 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Do you really speak \add what is\add* right \add when\add* silent?\f + \fr 58:1 \ft A slight emendation of the Hebrew text yields “what is right, O gods,” or “O mighty ones” \f*
\add Do\add* you judge fairly the children of humankind?\f + \fr 58:1 \ft Or “Do you judge fairly, O sons of humankind?” \f*
No, in \add your\add* heart you plan injustices;
in the land\f + \fr 58:2 \ft Or “on the earth” \f* you weigh out the violence of your hands.
The wicked are estranged from \add the\add* womb.
They go astray from \add the\add* belly, speaking lies.
Their venom \add is\add* like snake venom;
\add They are\add* like a deaf viper that closes its ear
so that it does not hear \add the\add* voice of charmers
\add or the\add* skilled caster of spells.
O God, break their teeth in their mouth.
Break off \add the\add* fangs of \add the\add* young lions, O Yahweh.
Let them run \add away\add* like water \add that\add* runs off.
\add When\add* he bends \add the bow\add*, let his arrows \add be\add* as though they were cut off.\f + \fr 58:7 \ft Or “as though they were withered \fq stalks \ft ” \f*
\add Let them be\add* like a snail \add that\add* melts away \add as\add* it goes;
\add like the\add* stillborn of woman \add that\add* do not see \add the\add* sun.
Before your pots can feel \add the heat of\add* a thornbush,
whether green \add or\add* ⸤dry⸥,\f + \fr 58:9 \ft Literally “burning” \f* he will sweep it away.\f + \fr 58:9 \ft The Hebrew of this verse is difficult to interpret \f*
\add The\add* righteous will rejoice when he sees \add the\add* vengeance;
he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
And people\f + \fr 58:11 \ft Hebrew “a person” \f* will say, “Surely \add there is\add* a ⸤reward⸥\f + \fr 58:11 \ft Literally “fruit” \f* for the righteous.
Surely there is a God \add who\add* judges in the land.”\f + \fr 58:11 \ft Or “on the earth” \f*
